column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I'm surprised that there is anyone that would give this museum less than 5 stars.  The Art Institute does a great job of displaying it's world class collection.  It does not have as large a collection as many well known international museums.  However
column2: you won't find as many "lesser" works here.   If you've studied art history at all
column3: many of the famous paintings you studied are hanging in Chicago.  If they don't belong to the Art Institute
column4: they often come through in the fabulous shows.  There are amazing colletions in Detroit
column6: and Milwaukee too.  If you've visited many museums in other countries
column7: you'll be surprised to find that even our smaller cities' museums have better quality art.  Yeah for the New World!
